caption:
This photograph captures a whimsical bronze sculpture depicting characters from Alice in Wonderland, located in a park setting. The sculpture features several distinct figures: Alice, who sits atop a large mushroom, observes the scene; the Mad Hatter, identifiable by his oversized top hat and distinctive attire, stands prominently; and the March Hare appears in mid-motion. These main characters are surrounded by other smaller, fantastical elements and creatures that add to the enchanting theme of the sculpture.

In the background, a lush, green environment with trees and a well-maintained lawn hints at a well-visited public park. The city skyline, with modern high-rise buildings, contrasts starkly with the natural and playful elements of the sculpture, suggesting a setting in an urban park. 

Some visitors to the park are also visible; for instance, a child interacts closely with the sculpture, climbing near Alice's figure, indicating the interactive and appealing nature of the artwork for all ages. There's also a baby stroller parked to the side, suggesting that this is a family-friendly location.

The overall composition of the photo, with its blend of urban and bucolic elements, alongside the interactive nature of the sculpture, makes it a vibrant snapshot of urban life intersecting with artistic and recreational spaces.
title: Alice-in-wonderland statue overlooking "the pond," in the southeast corner of central park
